originalText.text: please pay no attention to the comment left by that person who says that you can't rent rooms here, you can! That person is a liar, you can read beautiful look at the high ceilings in my photographs and updated light fixtures it's beautiful here there's even a garden as shown in my pictures, stay for one night stay for a month stay for years they predicted it doesn't matter the prices are amazing and so helpful, they turn down your bed every day there's maids that come and leave your chocolates and they even like I don't know whatever you name it but you can come here and you can sleep you you can do anything here and it's amazing everybody will love you better to come if you do it!

originalText.text: This is a hotel turned shelter for the homeless people from different walks of life. The residents are troubled and at times I have feared for my life here. The staff doesn’t really do much but sit down on the first floor and the only actual work I see getting done is when they distribute the mail or give out toiletries. There are only guest allowed for certain residents and it’s at the Yale employees discretion. The only floor that is safe is the first flooor because there are no cameras on the remaining floors which makes it extremely dangerous for the residents...

originalText.text: It's quiet all day every day,  no loud talking in the hallways, it's in a nice area, not fat from the subway or busses, stores in the area,  and  the staff is great.  But has it's flaws that can be fixed, but overall it a great  SRO. The one essential thing it needs is air conditioning. I love it....

text.text: It's quiet all day every day,  no loud talking in the hallways, it's in a nice area, not fat from the subway or busses, stores in the area,  and  the staff is great.  But has it's flaws that can be fixed, but overall it a great  SRO. The one essential thing it needs is air conditioning. I love it....

originalText.text: Needs some upgrades. So I designed a custom space layout. Had to rectify the situation in Court and would like to place the request to ensure people living with disabilities have a space they design their own. This may be someone's last space before they die and it is important to give these people proper air conditioning, better programs and proper security, the rat situation needs to be fixed, the roaches need to be sprayed away and proper placements in all windows to get bugs out, they need beds without Bed Bugs and dressers without mold. I cannot believe these people are paying to have to live underneath these conditions. It is time to make this place a better space for all of us

originalText.text: This is an SRO (single room occupancy) that is housing homeless clients of various city funded programs. Not open to the public. Private temporary residences for the homeless. You CAN'T rent rooms here!
